meanings.sent1: During the competition, Sarah was outshooting all her opponents.
meanings.sent2: The skilled archer was outshooting everyone at the range.
meanings.sent3: The young basketball player was outshooting even the older players.
meanings.sent4: His accuracy with the bow was outshooting all expectations.
meanings.sent5: Outshooting the target, she proved her marksmanship.

meanings.definition: To shoot beyond or outside of something.
meanings.sent1: The arrow went outshooting the bullseye.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally outshot the target and hit the tree behind it.
meanings.sent3: The paintball player kept outshooting the marked boundaries.
meanings.sent4: The baseball player outshot the outfield with his powerful hit.
meanings.sent5: Outshooting the goal, the soccer player missed the net.

meanings.definition: The act of shooting out or projecting outward.
meanings.sent1: The sudden outshooting of water surprised the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: The outshooting of sparks from the fire lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The outshooting of confetti made the celebration even more festive.
meanings.sent4: The outshooting of light from the lighthouse guided the ships safely.
meanings.sent5: The outshooting of flames from the rocket was spectacular.
